categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text: Several pull requests have been submitted to the elizaOS/eliza repository focusing on improvements to the local-AI functionality. PR #4204 externalizes fastembed and node-llama-cpp in local-ai, while PR #4203 removes remaining ollama references in the local-ai plugin. PR #4205 replaces fastembed with a local embedding model. These changes appear to be part of a broader effort to refine the AI capabilities of the system.

UI and functionality improvements have been made through several PRs. PR #4201 darkens borders and focus states in UI components for better visibility. PR #4209 addresses a fix for the Starting Agent. PR #4199 resolves an issue with elizaos port unavailability, improving system accessibility.

Plugin and client functionality has been enhanced through multiple PRs. PR #4202 improves the plugin installation strategy and code. PR #4206 adds Twitter client functionality. PR #4212 implements a feature to skip response checks for direct messages. Additionally, PR #4208 updates the CLI readme documentation.

categories.title: Recent ElizaOS Pull Requests and Updates

content.text: Several improvements have been made to the local-ai plugin in ElizaOS. The team externalized fastembed and node-llama-cpp (PR #4204) and removed remaining ollama references (PR #4203). Additionally, PR #4205 fixed an issue by replacing fastembed with a local embedding model.

The plugin system received enhancements with improved installation strategy and code (PR #4202), and a fix for runtime.registerPlugin after initialization (PR #4189). Documentation issues related to adding, removing, and listing plugins were also resolved (PR #4200).

UI improvements were implemented with darkened borders and focus states in UI components (PR #4201). Performance optimizations were made by reducing chunk size and returning only RAG fragments (PR #4188). Additionally, an issue with elizaos port unavailability was resolved (PR #4199).

The elizaos/eliza repository showed consistent activity over a two-day period. From April 6-7, 2025, there were 7 new PRs with all 7 being merged, and 7 active contributors participated. The following day (April 7-8, 2025) saw similar PR activity with 7 new PRs, though only 2 were merged. There was also 1 new issue opened during this second day, and contributor participation increased to 10 active contributors.
sources: From 2025-04-06 to 2025-04-07, elizaos/eliza had 7 new PRs (7 merged), 0 new issues, and 7 active contributors.
From 2025-04-07 to 2025-04-08, elizaos/eliza had 7 new PRs (2 merged), 1 new issues, and 10 active contributors.

content.text: The provided sources mention 'Top contributors for elizaOS/eliza' but do not provide any specific details about who these contributors are or their contributions to the project. Without additional information, it's not possible to generate a detailed summary about the contributors to the elizaOS/eliza project.

categories.title: OpenAI Plugin using gpt-4-vision-preview model leading to 404 error

content.text: GitHub issue #4210 reports a problem with the OpenAI Plugin when using the gpt-4-vision-preview model, which results in a 404 error. The issue was opened by user LongJeongS in the elizaOS/eliza repository.
